title: Login screen keeps loading when trying to login with the same user
description:
### Summary
The login screen stalls when trying to log in with an existing user

We should show a warning message and cancel the operation

title: Base UI Typography components
description:
### Summary

Implement the base typography component following the design guidelines #3608 

I'm splitting each of the base components creation into three parts.

#### Creation
Creation of the base component initial version following what was done and agreed on the Icon one. This is composed of structure, design and single use.

#### Spread
Spread it throughout the current UI in order to understand how it can be best adapted for using in the legacy application, adapting the props and exposing the necessary component wrappers.

#### Performance
Analyze the component's performance on the benchmarking tool to understand if any additional tweaks could be made to improve it's render/update phase either through memoization or exposing new wrappers.

title: InAppBrowser: Add The Option To Change Default Browser
description:
Currently all links are using in-app browser. This opens SafariServices/AuthenticationServices on iOS and Chrome Custom Tabs on android. But we should also give users the option to use their own browsers.

**as a user I want to be able to use my own browser when viewing links**
- given I've clicked a link for the first time, a bottom sheet should be shown in which I can select whether I want to use the in-app browser or my own browser
  - I should see a hint that I can change this behavior later in settings
  - After selecting the option, links should always use my preference
- given I want to change the default behavior of external link openings, I should see an option in settings that allows me to change this settings
  - this option should be in ___ [TBD]

title: Actionsheet / active keyboard issue
description:
### Summary

When the search input in discovery is active (keyboard displayed), tapping on the filter icon, the actionsheet is launched, but the keyboard is not killed. See screenshot below.

### Steps to reproduce

See above

### Platform information 

iOS - 4.18.0

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

In such a case, the keyboard should be hidden, so the action sheet is fully accessible.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

title: Ability to post from channel screen
description: Channel screen is an extension of the newsfeed. It makes sense for the post button to be available there. We don't want the users to have to go all the way back to newsfeed to post something when they are deep into the navigation stack.

title: Can't reach the server error in notifications
description:
![Simulator_Screen_Shot_-_iPhone_12_-_2021-09-16_at_16.41.12](/uploads/2c150fd1bfedfe452cb2b5d1e31e27b6/Simulator_Screen_Shot_-_iPhone_12_-_2021-09-16_at_16.41.12.png)
### Summary

Seems to happen in new accounts or when there is no notifications to show

title: Video upload issues
description:
## Summary

When you capture a portrait video directly on the app, there are multiple issues.

1. Immediately after posting, the dimensions are wrong and the post says There was an error displaying the media. This is really bad UX and makes the user think something broke, as the video has an error message and does not play.

![IMG_7882](/uploads/6d6294ed10da1f202d64baddbee8baa6/IMG_7882.PNG)



2. After a few minutes, the error message goes away. However, the dimensions are still incorrect on the thumbnail, and when you play the video, it converts to portrait but is squashed into landscape dimensions.

![IMG_7883](/uploads/58a262c3b84a3f1fb14fa2ecdff6c496/IMG_7883.PNG)

title: Notification issues
description:
## Summary

- Issues with notifications in the latest build.

## Issue 1

- Can only see two notifications in the All notifications tab for the @mindsplus account, despite knowing there are thousands. When you filter to specific notification types, you see more of them. Video is too large to upload.

## Issue 2

- Within the notification tabs, there are multiple issues with spacing causing things to overlap

**Screenshots**

![IMG_7885](/uploads/2481d2de4ad5d957e86a1eee6083ae30/IMG_7885.PNG)

![IMG_7884](/uploads/107121354d702891dfc99dd42868fe86/IMG_7884.PNG)

title: Lost ability to @tag autocomplete
description:
Proposed Designs - WIP

* Compose screen -> https://www.sketch.com/s/b0895a24-57a1-4e79-8e58-2aeb2a8cdb7e/a/dl7Z4x2
* As the user enters the `@` symbol a list of channels is displays. Front load channels the user subscribes to.
  * User can close the channel overlay by tapping a channel from the list, or backspacing to remove the `@` symbol or creating a space after the channel they've typed.
  * https://www.sketch.com/s/b0895a24-57a1-4e79-8e58-2aeb2a8cdb7e/a/JnmDlM5
* As the user continues to type a channel, the suggested list adapts accordingly -> https://www.sketch.com/s/b0895a24-57a1-4e79-8e58-2aeb2a8cdb7e/a/1K8Zwqa
* Channel reference successfully inserted -> https://www.sketch.com/s/b0895a24-57a1-4e79-8e58-2aeb2a8cdb7e/a/pamlqdr


### Comment context

* https://www.sketch.com/s/b0895a24-57a1-4e79-8e58-2aeb2a8cdb7e/a/g0dLleM
* https://www.sketch.com/s/b0895a24-57a1-4e79-8e58-2aeb2a8cdb7e/a/8ybD41x
* https://www.sketch.com/s/b0895a24-57a1-4e79-8e58-2aeb2a8cdb7e/a/g0dL8qr


### Hashtag autocomplete

* https://www.sketch.com/s/b0895a24-57a1-4e79-8e58-2aeb2a8cdb7e/a/g0dL8Ez

title: The login and splash screens should be loked in portrait
Change language in 'discovery' -> 'boosted' for Minds+
description:
### Summary

When following the steps below, the text shows as "Your newsfeed is empty".  

## Proposal

It should say "You have boost disabled with Minds+. To see boosted content, go to 'settings' and enable boosted content."

### Steps to reproduce

1. Go to 'settings' in Minds+
2. Turn boost off
3. Go to 'discovery' -> 'boosted'
4. Read the text

- Deliver first iteration of build your algorithm on web and mobile
- A\B test guest mode
- Have a ceramic prototype running
- Integrate GAT to CI flow

title: New subscriber push notification
description: When a channel receives a new subscriber, a push notification is sent through on mobile. However, tapping the push notification, on iOS at least, navigates the user to their own channel, and not the channel of their new subscriber. Upon tapping, the user should be navigated to the channel of the new subscriber.

title: In-App Browser
description:
Created from https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3520

Add an in-app browser to open links inside the app and let the user stay in the app.

A promising library is [React Native In-App Browser](https://github.com/proyecto26/react-native-inappbrowser) as discussed with @msantang78. It uses Chrome Custom Tabs on Android & SafariServices/AuthenticationServices on iOS.

Notes:
- We need to be very careful here not to break deeplinking. Youtube links are our most popular rich embed, it would be a shame if they now open in a webapp vs the youtube app. https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3520#note_662077947
- We need to test how the web app works on a webview, and to figure out how to "share" the session between the app and the webview. https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3520#note_658011264

title: Android app restarts if device is rotated
description:
### Summary

In order to support rotated videos and images I need to enable rotation support into the app (we currently have this limited at project level on android and ios to portrait), but because we are also limiting it with the navigator we can allow this and control it at screens level.

The problem is that currently the app is restarting each time the user rotate the device

### Steps to reproduce

(How one can reproduce the issue - this is very important)

### Platform information 

Android

title: Implement a new camera component with rn-vision-camera
description:
Implement a new camera package using react-native-vision-camera

- [x] Video and image capture
- [x] Zoom support
- [x] focus support
- [x] Improved UI

title: Draft: Newsfeed V2
description:
This issue was born out of a discussion with @msantang78 and me.

Includes some functionalities such as:

1. scroll position persistence. when app is closed and opened, the newsfeed scroll position and data is saved. This requires support for multidirectional pagination on the backend
2. ~~new post indication: newsfeed should keep itself up to date. When new posts are available for a feed, an indication could be shown on top that the user can click and scroll to top to load and see those new posts.~~ 
3. smooth scroll to top: when pressing home, the feed should smoothly scroll to top and then start reloading. If there are a lot of items on top, it could jump.

title: Build 4.17.0  manually for iOS
description: The CI build is having an issue with the photo import, so we will need to build it manually

title: Fix iOS CI build error with the photo selector
description:
The image picker fails on iOS if the app is built on circle CI but not if I do it locally. The app is built correctly, the rest of the features are working, but the image picker just fails.

We are using crop picker package: https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-native-image-crop-picker

This is a report of the issue: https://gitlab.com/minds/qa/qa/-/issues/41

I already tried:
  - Updating RN to the latest version
  - Updating the package to the latest version
  - Changing circle ci to use the same Xcode version that I have locally
  - Changing circle ci to use the latest version of Xcode

title: Upvotes modal freezing problem and other ui issues
description:
1. upvotes modal freezes after being opened and after loading placeholders. This is because of an issues with list item keys. Seen on android.
2. cancel button should have more margin from the bottom of the screen
3. placeholders should show the same number of items as the initial count of the interactions. e.g. if there are 10 dislikes, only show 10 placeholders
4. modal content should be handled better. currently the modal opens and it's transparent, but in the next frame it will get a primary background
5. loading line placeholders should be roughly in the same position and size as their content
6. loadMore should show a loading indicator at the end of the list. This loading should not be visible if the list was already showing a refresh indicator

title: Search crashes if there's no connection (offline)
description: Disconnect internet -> Open app -> Tap search = crash

title: Add restrictions to typescript settings
description:
### Summary

At least the unused var should be added and all the unused vars/imports should be removed. 

:warning: BE CAREFULL WITH THE SOME DEREFERENCE USED TO BIND OBSERVER COMPONENTS

iteration.description:
Sprint Objectives:

- Deliver first iteration of build your algorithm on web and mobile
- A\B test guest mode

- Integrate GAT to CI flow

title: Add handle bar to all BottomSheets
description:
as suggested by @michaelfbradley, we should add handle bars to bottomSheets to give a clue that the bottomsheet can be dismissed by a swipe down, and also adhere to ux guidelines.

![image](/uploads/b4b61439941f4c4d5a51823b03019f0b/image.png)

title: Revised Edit Channel screen
description:
As part of the improvements made to the channel screen by @manishoo - see below details on the revised channel settings / edit channel screen.

![edit-channel](/uploads/86506ed260d3fe5724b7bc2ed5cc7d86/edit-channel.mp4)

Notes:
- https://www.sketch.com/s/b7570ac0-3b2e-4a91-bca0-f9c5942fc89f/a/1KlGvwn
- Remove the 'Edit Channel' option from the ellipsis and simply include an edit button (where subscribe would other be displayed) https://www.sketch.com/s/b7570ac0-3b2e-4a91-bca0-f9c5942fc89f/a/Ax1wGJx
- This overlay screen is new functionality, and will be used again in the application.
- Animation duration of the overlay is 300ms (on entry and exit) - easing @ (0.25, 0.1, 0.25, 1.0)

title: Newsfeed: Extremely Tall Images
description:
an extremely tall image on the newsfeed makes it hard to navigate/scroll. This is handled well on the web by limiting the aspect ratio / height. but isn't quite handled on mobile. 

check https://www.minds.com/newsfeed/1280202767507394570 on mobile for reference

title: Use ChannelListItem in place of old DiscoveryUser
description:
in many places we're still using `DiscoveryUser` and `NewDiscoveryUser` components which are old and don't look good. We should instead replace them with ChannelListItem, or if they had some significantly different functionality, with another replacement (most likely ChannelListItem will be enough)

places that come to my mind:
- [ ] search
- [ ] subscribers/subscriptions list
- [ ] discovery

- document any challenges
- perhaps add tests for profile tweaks?

title: Show cached posts in the portrait bar while fetching new from server
description:
The portrait feed will now load posts from 00:00 of two days ago to allow caching. The previous implementation was fetching posts from `now() - 2 days` causing a cache miss every time because the parameter was changing each second. (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/merge_requests/1369/diffs)

We want to show the cached posts while we are fetching the new ones from the server. We can't just use the fetchLocalThenRemote method directly because we are grouping and ordering the posts before displaying them.

title: Test keep awake for videos on the iPhone
description: Test https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/merge_requests/1383 in the iPhone

title: Update to react native 0.65
description: - [ ] Remove intl polyfil

title: Error loading next page of offline cache
description:
### Summary
When there is no connectivity the app shows the cached entities, and if you start scrolling until it has to load the next page you see an error and you have to press 'try again' in order to get the next entities.

There are also some visual issues with that error message layout and colors

This error is probably a regression caused by the implementation of the new API service

title: Implement multi-user support
description:
With the new storage changes, where the cache and the information are stored on a by-user basis, we should be able to implement the multiuser support.

 - [x] Change the session storage to support multiple users
 - [x] Implement the user selector and login with other user options
 - [x] Implement the user change logic 
  - Ensure to fire the logout event so all the previous user data is cleared from the stores
  - Maybe it would be good to show the splash screen for a moment while switching users to hide the re-render of the main screen


### Design assets and notes

- Click through: https://www.sketch.com/s/d8dc6725-6ebb-4dcf-a558-958b8107779e/a/YGLZqee/play
- Revise nav drawer. Inclusion of switch profile icon: https://www.sketch.com/s/d8dc6725-6ebb-4dcf-a558-958b8107779e/a/3OjO9GZ
- New switch channel screen: https://www.sketch.com/s/d8dc6725-6ebb-4dcf-a558-958b8107779e/a/7yJyvg2
- Switch channel action sheet (from ellipsis): https://www.sketch.com/s/d8dc6725-6ebb-4dcf-a558-958b8107779e/a/oYJMMPx

There will be dependancy to have a 'modalised' variation of the login and registration processes to allow the user to login/register without losing context. I will create a follow up task for login / registration and will reference here.

* Unseen notification count is to be displayed per channel
* Tapping on a channel will switch the user and navigate to the newsfeed of the respective channel. Would be good to throw a toast notification here. e.g. `Switched to @channelName`
* When tapping on the ellipsis icon, an action sheet is displayed. They may explicitly 'Switch channel' or 'Logout'. The switch channel menu option would not appear if the selected channel is active.
* Logging out from here would then bring the user to the next available channel. Where the user logs out of the the only available channel, the user would then be redirected to the home screen.


### Issues 
- [ ] https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3559

title: Check the posibility of replace the camera package by react-native-vision-camera
description:
### Summary

This new package has more features and it could be faster. Between the most interesting features are:
- Multi-camera support
- Zoom support
- Focus
- Frame processors using worklets: It allows to do live post process or add IA with the performance of a native app without writing native code.

title: Voters dialog stays open in after navigating to another page

title: WIP: Compose UX
description:
The compose screen/feature is central to one of the two most important functionalities of the app: consumption and production.

But currently this feature is very basic.

WIP list:
- opening animation
- fast load and accessibility
- simple but rich UI
- is there a reason why the PHOTO type is selected by default on mobile compose? is there data to backup this assumption?
- is there data to backup the assumption that users will most likely use the front camera? because that is selected by default
- fast media uploads
- on lower-end devices, it takes some time for the camera module to load, and if the user wants to open the composer and post something quick, they'd have to unnecessary wait for the camera module to load and experience a small freeze
- Optimistic posting: after pressing send, the post gets added to the feed and the rest of the "loading"/"try again"/"failed to post" workflow will happen from the feed instead of the compose screen
- ...

title: Videos: Video should keep playing in the background when device is locked
description:
## Goal

Add the ability to keep playing the video while the app is in the background.

note: Youtube offers this only in premium

## What needs to be done

Change player default settings

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

none


## Personas

That will allow users to keep listening to a video while the app is in the background 

## Experiments

none


## Acceptance Criteria


- [ ] If the app is playing a video and is moved to the background it should keep playing

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

title: Videos: Floating Video
description: the playing video should stay floating around inside the app. and ideally user should have the option to keep the video floating around even outside the app.

title: Videos: Prevent Sleep
description: the device shouldn't go to sleep when videos are playing

title: Videos: UX
description:
* [ ] there's a black flash before a video is played which is clunky. especially in Stories (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3450)
* [ ] the device shouldn't go to sleep when videos are playing (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3451)
* [ ] BIG FEATURE the playing video should stay floating around when navigating minds (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3452)
* [ ] BIG FEATURE video may keep playing in the background when device is locked. this will make listening to long-form content (podcast, interview, event) far easier. (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3453)

title: Unnecessary onPress feedback

title: Custom Icons

- material icons are boring and commonly used
- minds needs more identity
- most important icons are the priority. such as icons of the tabbar, sidebar, and engagement and activity icons
